intro: Centaurea peucedanifolia, commonly known as the peucedanifolia centaurea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and spiny, bristly stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense, conical clusters. Centaurea peucedanifolia is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
